item.description:
This is part of the Wadsworth's "Summer Sizzle Under the Stars" series - five Friday night films, outdoors if the weather permits, inside if not.  The evening begins at 6:00pm with supper and live jazz, the film begins at 8:15pm.  I have set the start time for the film, but a group of us will met at the Cafe about 6:30pm for supper.

 

From this summer's flyer:  "With the advent of 'talkies' in the 1930's, American romantic screwball comedies became the rage.  On five Fridays in July and August, join us in the museum's outdoor courtyard for aummer supper (a la carte menu), live jazz, and classic comedies from the 1930's."

 

TONIGHT:  BRINGING UP BABY   (1938)

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0029947/

Directed by Howard Hawks.  Starring Katherine Hepburn and Cary Grant.  100 minutes.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: "Bringing Up Baby" @ Wadsworth Atheneum
